source: Consolidated from Google Trends (google_trends_interest.json), GDELT (gdelt_timeline.json), and Wikipedia (wikipedia_pageviews.json)

fields.metadata.generated_at: ISO 8601 timestamp when the data was generated
fields.metadata.sources: Array of source data files used
fields.metadata.note: Clarification that values are normalized relative attention scores, not sentiment
fields.weekly_timeline[].components: Breakdown of attention by source (Google Trends, GDELT, Wikipedia)
fields.weekly_timeline[].regions: Regional attention scores broken down by world region

notes: Contains 51 weeks of normalized attention scores combining Google Trends search interest, GDELT media coverage, and Wikipedia pageview data. Values are relative (not absolute sentiment). Regional breakdowns show how attention to US-related topics varied across world regions throughout 2025.
